Stem: Upright, cylindrical, sometimes hairy in lower parts.
Leaves: Light green, ribbed blades up to 50 cm long, sometimes longer. Initially rolled inward but flattening with age. Darker green underside and occasionally with purplish edges and tips.
Flowers: Dense cylindrical cluster 8-30 cm long containing hundreds of flower spikes. Pale brown to straw coloured with occasional purplish appearance.
FruitSeeds: Spikelets 5-7 mm long surrounded by feather-like bristles. With yellow to brown seeds.
Habitat: Grasslands, woodlands, river banks, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Typically has shorter bristles on the spikelets than other *Cenchrus* species.
